Triplets:<The Hidebehind
1:
--------------------
<Text: Hidebehind:  As its name suggests, the Hidebehind is noted for its ability to conceal itself.>
Triplets:<Hidebehind
2:
--------------------
Text: Hidebehind:  When an observer attempts to look directly at it, the creature hides again behind an object or the observer and therefore can't be directly seen: a feat it accomplishes by sucking in its stomach to a point where it is so slender that it can easily cover itself behind the trunk of any tree.
Triplets:<Hidebehind
3:
--------------------
Text: Hidebehind:  The Hidebehind uses this ability to stalk human prey without being observed and to attack without warning.
Triplets:<Hidebehind
4:
ere are the extracted triplets:

<Their victims
5:
--------------------
Text: Hidebehind:  The creature subsists chiefly upon the intestines of its victim, and has a severe aversion to alcohol, which is considered a sufficient repellent.

Triplets:
<Hidebehind
6:
--------------------
<Text: Hidebehind:  Tales of the Hidebehind may have helped explain strange noises in the forest at night.>
